messages.message:
Hey team, I have a backport PR that passes CI test but the status is not updated to github so I can't merge it. What should I do to resolve it?
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/44154

There’s a bug right now with the status update. @Cody Boggs can you make a louder announcement about this until it gets resolved? I imagine lots of folks will run into this.

In the meantime, I can force merge for you @Xindi Xu
Sure thing, I’ll blast it in a couple spots
Do you have an eta for resolution? Is it possible to revert/rollback in the meantime?
Yea I’m about to push a commit to get this job pushed back to GCP builders for now.
it’s own pr test pipeline is executing on GCP builders as expected: https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/instabase/job/PR-44180/1/console
(Wow this is a terribly slow and overwrought workflow on which to gate all of our PRs, btw :lolcry:)
yeah :disappointed: if there was some way to avoid re-downloading the jenkins image everytime, that would be huge.

For starters we should… not be using the Jenkins image for this.. :sweat_smile:

But that’s a question for folks who know what this job is doing, which isn’t me usually :smile:

mm it doesn’t have to be the same Jenkins image per se, but currently we need an image that has all the dependencies needed to run unit tests across all services + modules + languages, which means that it’s huge.

It’s definitely a big fix scope, but I would argue that we shouldn’t have one giant image with all the deps in it to start - because we shouldn’t be doing monolith testing for an ostensibly microservices architecture. :slightly_smiling_face:

But again… time and priorities and such
Yeah not saying that’s right, but just explaining why it’s so large today
Oh for sure :slightly_smiling_face: That’s how I took it :+1:
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/44155 @Cody Boggs could you please merge this PR? The premerge can pass but no update for Github
